member.name: T:AstroMaths.AstroMathFunctions
member.summary: Date : May 2022 Class library used to calculate Astronomical functions

member.name: M:AstroMaths.AstroMathFunctions.StarVelocity(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the velocity of a star in m/sec based on the doppler effect, it uses the rest and observed wavelength of light from star. The wave length is measured in nanometres = 1 x 10^-9, speed of light = 3 x 10^8 m/s. If a star has 500.0 nm at rest and 500.1 nm observed then velocity is 60,000 m/s
member.param: wave length of observed light from star
wave length of light at rest

member.name: M:AstroMaths.AstroMathFunctions.StarDistance(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the distance to a star in parsecs (3.26 light years). Barnard's Star has parallax angle of 0.547 arcseconds and has a distance = 1.83 parsec

member.name: M:AstroMaths.AstroMathFunctions.Kelvin(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the temperature in degrees Kelvin. refered to as the absolute temperature. The daily temp = 27 deg celsius which is Kelvin = 300 deg K

member.name: M:AstroMaths.AstroMathFunctions.EventHorizon(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the balck hole event horizon in metres. This is the Schwarzschild Radius which uses the gravitational constant G = 6.674 x 10^-11 and the Speed of light = 2.99792458 x 10^8 m/s. Sagittarius A* has a mass of 8.2 x 10^36 kgs and the event radius = 1.21780635 x 10^10 metres
member.param: mass of black hole in kgs
